headline: Tesla adds Chiptole CEO to board, Vistra & gas, Berkshire's buys
summary: Yahoo Finance host Madison Mills tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including Tesla (TSLA) adding Chipotle Mexican Grill (CMG) CEO Jack Hartung to its board, Vistra (VST) acquiring natural gas assets, and Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway (BRK-B, BRK-A) adjusting its positions in Citigroup (C), Constellation Brands (STZ), and Bank of America (BAC). Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Nuclear Stock Vistra Goes Big on Natural Gas. It’s an Answer to Growing Power Demand.
summary: Vistra  stock climbed Friday after the energy provider unveiled a $1.9 billion deal to broaden its natural gas portfolio.  The company said it had reached an agreement to acquire seven modern natural gas generation facilities from Connecticut-based  Lotus  Infrastructure Partners, totaling roughly 2,600 megawatts of capacity.  The acquisition includes five combined cycle gas turbine facilities and two combustion turbine facilities located across the East and West Coasts.

headline: Vistra to buy 2.6GW generation capacity from Lotus for $1.9bn
summary: The move enhances the geographical diversification of Vistra's natural gas fleet.

headline: Texas Utility Vistra Energy Expands Gas Power Holdings in $2 Billion Deal
summary: Vistra Energy invests $1.9 billion to acquire gas-powered generation capacity across multiple states in response to the projected surge in US electricity demand driven by data centers and AI development.
